info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN SOCORRO AND SOUTHWESTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 437 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Abo, or 31 miles southwest of Estancia, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mountainair, Gran Quivira and Abo. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 190 and 213, and near Mile Marker 217. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
